intro: Asarum tungyanshanianum, commonly known as the Tungyanshan wild ginger, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, hooded flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that contain kidney-shaped seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
